UI_visible_response: Individuals with low social credit scores in China can face a variety of consequences. They may be blocked from using dating sites and unable to enroll their children in preferred schools1. Additionally, if someone’s trustworthiness score is low, they might encounter limitations on the selection of schools available for their children and could even experience throttled internet speeds as a form of punishment2. People with low scores might also be restricted from leaving their domicile until their score improves3. Other repercussions include being placed on blacklists that result in flight bans, exclusion from private schools, and slower internet connections4. Furthermore, millions have already been blacklisted from booking flights or high-speed train tickets due to low social credit scores5. Overall, these measures aim to enforce the notion that “keeping trust is glorious and breaking trust is disgraceful”10.
traffic_visible_response: Individuals with low social credit scores in China can face a variety of consequences. They may be blocked from using dating sites and unable to enroll their children in preferred schools [[1]]. Additionally, if someone’s trustworthiness score is low, they might encounter limitations on the selection of schools available for their children and could even experience throttled internet speeds as a form of punishment [[2]]. People with low scores might also be restricted from leaving their domicile until their score improves [[3]]. Other repercussions include being placed on blacklists that result in flight bans, exclusion from private schools, and slower internet connections [[4]]. Furthermore, millions have already been blacklisted from booking flights or high-speed train tickets due to low social credit scores [[5]]. Overall, these measures aim to enforce the notion that “keeping trust is glorious and breaking trust is disgraceful” [[10]].
